title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MIAMI – On a night where offense was a precious commodity, the Miami Heat survived a historic scoring onslaught from one of the game’s most explosive talents.

In a brutal, defensive-minded 94-91 victory over the Atlanta Hawks, the Heat had no answer for Hawks guard Steve Smith—and they didn’t need one, as long as they had an answer for everyone else.

Smith was a one-man wrecking crew, detonating for a game-high 41 points. He carried the Atlanta offense on his back, slicing through the Miami defense and scoring from all three levels in a spectacular individual performance. Every time the Heat threatened to pull away, it was Smith who answered with a clutch basket to keep the Hawks within striking distance.

Yet, for all his heroics, Smith’s historic night was ultimately met with a balanced and relentless counter-punch from the host Heat. Miami’s victory was a testament to shared responsibility. Tim Hardaway orchestrated the attack with a solid 17-point, 9-assist double-double, while Alonzo Mourning anchored the paint, contributing 17 points and a game-high 13 rebounds for a double-double of his own.

The game hung in the balance until the final seconds, a taut defensive struggle defined by one incredible offensive outlier. Smith’s 41 points will be remembered as a legendary individual effort in a losing cause, a brilliant flame extinguished by the collective, grinding will of the Miami Heat.
